intro: Acer truncatum var. platanoides, commonly known as the European maple, is a deciduous tree native to Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and orange in autumn. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by winged samaras as its fruit. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and prefers well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and urban landscapes.
